I'm skimming
Totman, Conrad.  The Collapse of the Tokugawa Bakufu 1862-1868
USA:  The University Press of Hawaii, 1980. Isbn 082480614
and found the maps to be very useful...I can't remember if we 
already had maps uploaded somewhere...but in any case I have scanned 
(pdf)a map of Edo (you can see where Ueno Hill is located), Kanto 
Plain (Present day Tsukuba Univ where we have a record of S.H. 
teaching kenjutsu is pretty far from Edo/Tokyo) and Toba-Fushimi 
(note presence of swamps)

I inserted the citation in the pdf document...
http://www.streamload.com/secretarytocapt3
filename TotmanMaps
password makoto
file size 4.34 MB!!!!!I don't know why I thought I scanned it 
grayscale bitmap (shrugs)

[Sonno Joi]
I realized after skimming a few books that authors will each have 
their own way of attempting to identify the political stance(s) of 
certain groups. People back then may have been asking each 
other..."hey what do you believe in?"
A. Joi via force
B. Joi via negotiations
C. Sonno just outwardly to keep up "appearances" forget Joi we are 
making $$$
D. Pro/Sincere-Sonno but anti Joi
E. Anti-Sonno (which existed but not "officially" ofcourse) but Pro-
Joi
F. Anti Pro Sonno Joi altogether ^_^
G. Radical Sonno Joi (which some writers don't define clearly)
H. You are too confused to care but you ~do~ like that new catchy 
tune "Ee ja na kai Ee ja nai ka, ee ja nai ka"

[Sekihoutai]
I have been searching jstor.org with the keywords Phil sent me and 
not surprisingly...nothing has shown up...in fact none of the 
detailed indexes of history books even mention them...HOWEVER this 
may be simply due to how things are indexed...so I'm skimming all 
texts

For example...I've been looking for words like "Police" "Tokyo 
Metropolitan Police" "Kawaji" and a whole bunch of what seems to 
be "logical" words in indexes when I should be looking 
for "keihoryo" which some authors translate loosely as the law 
enforcement system...I found shreds of info on the TMPD's adoption 
of the kyu ranking system for kendo/kenjutsu too ^_^ during Fujita 
G's time in the dept.

[Stuff]
I don't understand the request on starting a forum on the 
messageboard with introductions...do you mean introducing us 
members?  Please explain just tell me what to do exactly.
